text: Quirino (2023). dna: Tools handling Missing Data. R package version 0.0.1, https://github.com/arturhgq/dna.
code: @Manual{,   title = {dna: Tools for handling Missing Data},   author = {Artur Quirino},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://github.com/arturhgq/dna}, }

title: Tools for handling Missing Data
text: goal dna provide useful tools handling Missing Data.

title: Tools for handling Missing Data
text: can install development version dna like :

what: Count NAs by group in a data frame — count_group_na
title: Count NAs by group in a data frame — count_group_na
Count NAs by group in a data frame — count_group_na
Count NAs by group in a data frame — count_group_na
text: data data frame vars variables counted. variables provided, function count Missing Values variables. group group variable format output data frame format ('longer' 'wider')

title: Count NAs by group in a data frame — count_group_na
text: Expected new features Allowing one group variable.

title: Count NAs by group in a data frame — count_group_na
code: tibble::tibble( var1 = c(1,2,3,4, NA), var2 = c(NA, NA, NaN, 2, 3), group = c(2010,2010,2012,2012, 2012) ) -> data count_group_na(data, group = group) #>   variable n group #> 1     var2 2  2010 #> 2     var1 0  2010 #> 3    group 0  2010 #> 4     var1 1  2012 #> 5     var2 1  2012 #> 6    group 0  2012

what: Count NAs in a data frame for each variable — count_na
title: Count NAs in a data frame for each variable — count_na
text: function counts NAs data frame variable

title: Count NAs in a data frame for each variable — count_na
Count NAs in a data frame for each variable — count_na
text: data data frame format output data frame format ('longer' 'wider')

title: Count NAs in a data frame for each variable — count_na
code: tibble::tibble( var1 = c(1,2,3,4, NA), var2 = c(NA, NA, NaN, 2, 3) ) -> data count_na(data) #>   variable n #> 1     var2 3 #> 2     var1 1 count_na(data, "wider") #>   var2 var1 #> 1    3    1

what: dna: Tools for handling Missing Data — dna-package
title: dna: Tools for handling Missing Data — dna-package
text: package provides tools handling Missing Data.

title: dna: Tools for handling Missing Data — dna-package

what: Fill in missing values within groups — fill_by_group
title: Fill in missing values within groups — fill_by_group
text: function fills missing values within groups

title: Fill in missing values within groups — fill_by_group
Fill in missing values within groups — fill_by_group
text: .data data frame .group group variable ... variables filled. variables provided, function fill missing values variables.

title: Fill in missing values within groups — fill_by_group
code: data.frame(    var1 = c(NA,2,3,NA),    var2 = c(NA,NA,3,3),    var3 = c(NA,1,3,3),    var4 = c(10,NA, 2,NA),    group = c(1,1,2,2)  ) -> data   fill_by_group(data, group, var1, var3) #> # A tibble: 4 × 5 #>    var1  var2  var3  var4 group #>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     2    NA     1    10     1 #> 2     2    NA     1    NA     1 #> 3     3     3     3     2     2 #> 4     3     3     3    NA     2

what: Is x a non-missing element? — not_na
title: Is x a non-missing element? — not_na
Is x a non-missing element? — not_na
Is x a non-missing element? — not_na

what: Replace NAs by a value — replace_na
title: Replace NAs by a value — replace_na
Replace NAs by a value — replace_na
Replace NAs by a value — replace_na
text: .data data frame ... variables. variables provided, function fill Missing Values variables. .value value NAs replaced

title: Replace NAs by a value — replace_na
code: tibble::tibble(      var1 = c(1,2,3,4, NA),      var2 = c(NA, NA, NaN, 2, 3)    ) -> data replace_na(data, .value = 0) #> # A tibble: 5 × 2 #>    var1  var2 #>   <dbl> <dbl> #> 1     1     0 #> 2     2     0 #> 3     3     0 #> 4     4     2 #> 5     0     3
